start.title: Graphs of Dynamic Situations Virtual tool
start.p1: This tool is designed to help you to understand graphs of dynamic relationships. The tool does this by illustrating these relationships with concrete examples in Virtual Reality and by providing targeted feedback on the graph you have drawn yourself.
start.p2: This is a proof of concept, which only works with a single example of a dynamic context.

intro.p1: You are now going to draw a graph of a dynamic relationship. You can do this on the screen using a mouse, stylus or finger.
intro.p2: Once you are satisfied with your graph you hand it in. You will receive specific feedback on your work.

assignments.description: Imagine that this bottle is filled with water; the water flows at a constant speed.
assignments.questions_li1: Sketch a graph in which you draw the height of the water in the bottle compared to the amount of water in the bottle.

compare.title: Compare and hand in
compare.p: Compare the charts. Are you satisfied? If so, hand in your work.

feedback.title: Result
feedback.label_reward: Your chart represents the following object
feedback.switch_0: You're on your way to level 1: You used help 1 and/or help 2 to assist you in sketching your graphs. To reach the next levels, you must figure out the relation between the height and volume of water given the shape of the vase.
feedback.switch_1: You have reached level 1: You figured out the relation between the amount of water and the height in one of the two exercises. To reach the next level you should also consider the shape of the vases.
feedback.switch_2: You have reached level 2; You figured out the relation between the amount of water and the height in both exercises.
feedback.without_help: You have not used any of the help offered
feedback.some_help: You have not used all the help offered
feedback.all_help: You have used all the help offered
feedback.applied_help: but you did try to apply it
